info.title: Appointments
info.x-hubspot-introduction: Use the appointments API to create and manage CRM records that represent information about an encounter or service for an individual. Identify the appointment object type with its object type ID 0-421

createdResourceId.description: The unique identifier of the newly created resource.

location.description: The URL location of the newly created resource.

category.description: The main category of the error.

context.description: Additional context-specific information related to the error.

id.description: A unique ID for the error instance.

links.description: URLs linking to documentation or resources associated with the error.

message.description: A human-readable string describing the error and possible remediation steps.

status.description: The HTTP status code associated with the error.

subCategory.description: A more specific error category within each main category.

fromObjectId.description: The ID of the originating object in the label association.

fromObjectTypeId.description: The type ID of the originating object in the label association.

labels.description: An array of labels associated with the object pair.

toObjectId.description: The ID of the target object in the label association.

toObjectTypeId.description: The type ID of the target object in the label association.

completedAt.description: The timestamp when the batch processing was completed, in ISO 8601 format.

links.description: An object containing relevant links related to the batch request.

numErrors.description: The number of errors that occurred during the batch operation.

requestedAt.description: The timestamp when the batch request was initially made, in ISO 8601 format.

startedAt.description: The timestamp when the batch processing began, in ISO 8601 format.

status.description: The status of the batch processing request: "PENDING", "PROCESSING", "CANCELLED", or "COMPLETE"

BatchResponseSimplePublicObject.description: A public object batch response object

toObjectId.description: The ID of the target object in the association.

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

id.description: The unique ID of the object.

category.description: The category of the association, such as 'HUBSPOT_DEFINED', 'USER_DEFINED', or 'INTEGRATOR_DEFINED'.

label.description: The label associated with the type of association.

typeId.description: The ID representing the specific type of association.

idProperty.description: When using a custom unique value property to retrieve records, the name of the property. Do not include this parameter if retrieving by record ID.

properties.description: Key-value pairs for setting properties for the new object.

propertiesWithHistory.description: Key-value pairs for setting properties for the new object and their histories.

BatchReadInputSimplePublicObjectId.description: Specifies the input for reading a batch of CRM objects, including arrays of object IDs, requested property names (with optional history), and an optional unique identifying property.

completedAt.description: The timestamp when the batch process was completed, in ISO 8601 format.

links.description: An object containing relevant links related to the batch request.

requestedAt.description: The timestamp when the batch process was initiated, in ISO 8601 format.

startedAt.description: The timestamp when the batch process began execution, in ISO 8601 format.

status.description: The status of the batch processing request. Can be: "PENDING", "PROCESSING", "CANCELED", or "COMPLETE".

BatchResponseSimplePublicUpsertObject.description: Represents the result of a batch upsert operation, including the operations status, timestamps, and a list of successfully created or updated objects.

sourceId.description: The unique ID of the property.

timestamp.description: The timestamp when the property was updated, in ISO 8601 format.

updatedByUserId.description: The ID of the user who last updated the property.

archivedAt.description: The timestamp when the object was archived, in ISO 8601 format.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the object was created, in ISO 8601 format.

id.description: The unique ID of the object.

objectWriteTraceId.description: Unique ID to identify each write operation, which will be returned with any errors to identify which request encountered which error.

properties.description: Key-value pairs representing the properties of the object.

propertiesWithHistory.description: Key-value pairs representing the properties of the object along with their history.

updatedAt.description: The timestamp when the object was last updated, in ISO 8601 format.

url.description: URL to go to the object

id.description: The unique ID of the object.

after.description: A paging cursor token for retrieving subsequent pages.

filterGroups.description: Up to 6 groups of filters defining additional query criteria.

limit.description: The maximum results to return, up to 200 objects.

properties.description: A list of property names to include in the response.

query.description: The search query string, up to 3000 characters.

sorts.description: Specifies sorting order based on object properties.

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

example.message: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

id.description: The unique ID of the object.

idProperty.description: The name of a property whose values are unique for this object

objectWriteTraceId.description: An identifier for tracing the creation request.

properties.description: Key value pairs representing the properties of the object.

SimplePublicObjectBatchInputUpsert.description: Represents an object used in batch upsert operations, containing an objects unique identifier, its properties, and optionally the unique property name and a write trace ID.

idProperty.description: The name of a property whose values are unique for this object

objectId.description: The unique identifier of the object to be fully purged along with any GDPR-related data.

properties.description: Key value pairs representing the properties of the object.

SimplePublicObjectInput.description: Represents the input required to create or update a CRM object, containing an object with property names and their corresponding values.

completedAt.description: The timestamp when the batch processing was completed, in ISO 8601 format.

links.description: An object containing relevant links related to the batch request.

numErrors.description: The number of errors that occurred during the batch operation.

requestedAt.description: The timestamp when the batch request was initially made, in ISO 8601 format.

startedAt.description: The timestamp when the batch processing began, in ISO 8601 format.

status.description: The status of the batch processing request: "PENDING", "PROCESSING", "CANCELLED", or "COMPLETE".

associationCategory.description: The category of the association, such as "HUBSPOT_DEFINED".

associationTypeId.description: The ID representing the specific type of association.

AssociationSpec.description: Defines the type, direction, and details of the relationship between two CRM objects.

objectIdToMerge.description: The object ID to merge with the primary object.

primaryObjectId.description: The object ID of the primary object to merge.

archivedAt.description: The timestamp when the object was archived, in ISO 8601 format.

associations.description: A list defining relationships with other objects.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the object was created, in ISO 8601 format.

id.description: The unique ID of the object.

objectWriteTraceId.description: An identifier for tracing the creation or update request of the object.

properties.description: Key value pairs representing the properties of the object.

propertiesWithHistory.description: Key-value pairs representing the properties of the object along with their history.

updatedAt.description: The timestamp when the object was last updated, in ISO 8601 format.

url.description: The URL associated with the CRM object.

SimplePublicObjectWithAssociations.description: Represents a CRM object along with its properties, timestamps, and a set of associated object IDs grouped by association type.

highValue.description: The upper boundary value when using ranged-based filters.

propertyName.description: The name of the property to apply the filter to.

value.description: The value to match against the property.

values.description: The values to match against the property.

Filter.description: Defines a single condition for searching CRM objects, specifying the property to filter on, the operator to use (such as equals, greater than, or contains), and the value(s) to compare against.

before.description: A paging cursor token for retrieving previous pages.

link.description: A URL that can be used to retrieve the previous pages' results.

PreviousPage.description: specifies the paging information needed to retrieve the previous set of results in a paginated API response

archivedAt.description: The timestamp when the object was archived, in ISO 8601 format.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the object was created, in ISO 8601 format.

id.description: The unique ID of the object.

objectWriteTraceId.description: An identifier for tracing the creation or update request.

properties.description: Key value pairs representing the properties of the object.

propertiesWithHistory.description: Key-value pairs representing the properties of the object along with their history.

updatedAt.description: The timestamp when the object was last updated, in ISO 8601 format.

url.description: The URL associated with the object.

SimplePublicUpsertObject.description: Represents a CRM object that has either been created or updated (upserted)

id.description: The id to be updated. This can be the object id, or the unique property value of the idProperty property

idProperty.description: The name of a property whose values are unique for this object

objectWriteTraceId.description: A unique identifier for tracing the request.

properties.description: Key-value pairs representing the properties of the object.

SimplePublicObjectBatchInput.description: Contains an array of CRM object records to be processed in a batch operation, each defined by their ID and properties.

objectWriteTraceId.description: An identifier for tracing the creation request.

properties.description: Key-value pairs representing the properties of the object.

id.description: The ID for the association type.

AssociatedId.description: Contains the id and type of an association

after.description: A paging cursor token for retrieving subsequent pages.

link.description: A URL that can be used to retrieve the next page results.

NextPage.description: Specifies the paging information needed to retrieve the next set of results in a paginated API response

properties.description: Key-value pairs for setting properties for the new object.

SimplePublicObjectInputForCreate.description: Is the input object used to create a new CRM object, containing the properties to be set and optional associations to link the new record with other CRM objects.

scopes.crm.objects.companies.sensitive.read.v2: View sensitive properties on company records
scopes.crm.objects.companies.sensitive.write.v2: Create or update sensitive properties on company records
scopes.crm.objects.contacts.sensitive.read.v2: View sensitive properties on contact records
scopes.crm.objects.contacts.sensitive.write.v2: Create or update sensitive properties on contact records

scopes.crm.objects.deals.sensitive.write.v2: Create or update sensitive properties on deal records
